intro: Malvastrum palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
